thread.title: Jose Mourinho on collision course with FA over Marcus Rashford playing for England Under-21s
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho on collision course with FA over Marcus Rashford playing for England Under-21s

author: smorgan
title: Jose Mourinho on collision course with FA over Marcus Rashford playing for England Under-21s
text:
Rash choices Jose Mourinho on collision course with FA over Marcus Rashford playing for England Under-21s 
Manchester United manager eager for teenager not to be exhausted but Aidy Boothroyd will want him for the Euros By Mike McGrath Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MARCUS RASHFORD is ready to go the Under-21 Euros this summer – as long as Jose Mourinho gives his blessing. 
The Manchester United forward, 21, has broken into the senior England squad but is wanted for Aidy Boothroyd’s cubs. PA:Press Association 4 Marcus Rashford says it will be up to his bosses where he plays in the summer 
It has put United boss Mourinho on a collision course with the FA over using the teenager at the end of the season. 
Rashford said: “It is up to the coaching staff and the managers to decide if I go to that. 
“But if I do go, I’ll be approaching it with the same attitude as I do to the seniors. It is exciting times. 
“Getting tournament experience is massive, as long as everything is aiming towards the long-term objective, we obviously want to be successful and win trophies. 
“So whatever we have to do to get to that, whether it is going down to gain the experience, everyone is happy to do that.” PA:Press Association Jose Mourinho is set for a collision course with the FA over how much Marcus Rashford plays 
Rashford has highlighted the importance of tournament experience, with last summer’s disastrous Euros his first taste. 
He said: “Obviously there is are a lot of lessons to be learnt. It was my first major tournament and going out was disappointing. 
“At the time you never want to be knocked out of a tournament, you always picture yourself going on to win it. 
“All we can do now is get those experiences that we gained in the Iceland game and put everything together and move on for the future.” 
Rashford has struggled for goals this season with his last Premier League strike coming in September. 
But he insists he is a better all-round player this season under Mourinho. Rex Features Marcus Rashford insists he is a better all-round player under Jose Mourinho Getty Images The England ace has lauded the impact the Portuguese has had on his run Gareth Southgate steps in after Marcus Rashford forgets to clap England fans Most read in football Not good enough Antonio Conte has sensationally rejected the chance to sign Neymar in a £155m deal from Barcelona leg-break horror Seamus Coleman set for surgery on potential career-threatening injury after his leg is snapped in half by Neil Taylor's wild tackle TV TIMES What TV channel is England vs Lithuania on, what time is kick-off and what is the latest team news? LIONHEART Brave Bradley Lowery gets the biggest cheer at Wembley as he leads out the England team with goal hero and best mate Jermain Defoe Seeing Red Keith Gillespie launches viscous elbow into face of opponent during Man United charity match 'I don't even like football' Neil Taylor is hammered on Twitter after breaking Seamus Coleman’s leg… but it’s an ex-councillor not the Wales defender taking the brunt of the abuse 
He said: “I’m a completely different player now compared to where I was this time last season. 
“People don’t always look at that, they look at the results but they don’t look at what you do to get the results. When it all comes together people will start to realise. 
“My overall game has changed. I’ve been playing in wider positions and now me knowing what the forwards wants helps me, and also helps me know that the winger wants when I get in the middle. 
“Time goes very fast and it is about what you do in that time. All my focus is just on trying to improve for the future and to make history for my club and the country.”
